intro: Taplinia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Liliaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. They typically grow in woodland areas and have a long history of use in traditional medicine. However, many species are toxic and should be handled with care.
